page.title: 17Housing in Longfield
page.content: All families are well housed although some enjoy a higher standard of living than others. The shift towards smaller families means that most children have a bedroom of their own;this is much more than a room in which to sleep. It is used to entertain friends ,to watch T.V.and a place in which to do homework. Meals consist of breakfast,lunch and dinner;lunch is usually taken at school during term-time. Many families have two wage-earners,but a high car ownership means that families can still do things together,especially at weekends. The population shift means that there are fewer extended families than before the war,and there are more nuclear families. There are families formed by remarriage,and there are many one-parent families
